definition: what is your surname?/(May I ask) your surname?

sentences.english: The name of the being you are calling, please?
sentences.chinese: 请问受话人的贵姓大名？

sentences.english: I do not even know your name.
sentences.chinese: 我连您贵姓也还不知道。

sentences.english: We have two Mikes here. Could you tell me his last name, please?
sentences.chinese: 我们这里有两个迈克。可不可以请你告诉我他贵姓呢？

sentences.english: Pardon me, monsieur the inn-keeper, but what is your name?
sentences.chinese: 对不起，客店老板先生，您贵姓？

sentences.english: The name of the person you are calling, please?
sentences.chinese: 请问受话人的贵姓台甫？

definition: to introduce oneself/originally a theatrical device in which a character explains his own role
honorific: I've long looked forward to meeting you./It's an honor to meet you at last.
two-character surname such as 司馬|司马 or 諸葛|诸葛
I have been enlightened by your teaching (humble)
lit. your honored carriage/your highness/honored Sir (also sarcastic)/you
I have been looking forward to meeting you for a long time (idiom)
literary name (an alternative name of a person stressing a moral principle)/courtesy name
(literary) I trust you have been well since we last met
we are honored by your presence
sir (respectful form of address for an old man)
